page.title: 01Country Around Brig O'Cally
page.content: This is a remote rural area where the two bus services which run through the area are a school bus and a postal bus which take passengers. During the period of this survey the area is very quiet but this place is busy in winter during the skiing season when there is considerable passing trade and again in summer during the tourist season. The farming industry is divided between the growing of farm crops and hill sheep farming. Approximately one sixth of the area is under forestry (mainly fir) this being part of Blackcraig Forest. The few roads have good surfaces but tend to be narrow and twisting. The hotels here would expect to have some business from sporting fishermen as two rivers meet just below Bridge Of Cally.
